Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); 18TH DYNASTY ?; NEW KINGDOM (not after)
Name: Vase with pointed bottom
Description: This vase of terracotta comes from the excavations of W. Loat at Gurob in 1903-1904. It is characterised by an elongated belly with a pointed bottom and is fitted with two handles. The long neck, which carries at the base a decoration painted in red (a cord?), is defined by a small projecting edge. This type of receptacle, which needs a stand, is often represented in the Theban tombs of the 18th Dynasty.
